label: Untitled 9: React hydration + error logging bootstrap
doc: Bootstraps a React app by hydrating server-rendered HTML into a live client app, with aggressive error logging (especially hydration errors) and a global handle to the root for debugging.

children.label: Globals & inputs
children.doc: Reads state/config injected by server-side rendering and exposes a few debugging handles on window.

children.label: Logging + hydration error diagnostics
children.doc: Captures hydration errors and logs them with contextual hints so mismatches between server markup and client render can be diagnosed.

children.label: App init logs
children.doc: Writes a startup banner and initial state presence info to the console.

children.label: onRecoverableError handler
children.doc: React calls this for recoverable errors during hydration/render. The code logs the error and tries to detect "Hydration failed" patterns to add guidance.

children.label: React hydration root
children.doc: Attaches React to existing DOM (#root) and renders <App/> with initial state, using startTransition to avoid blocking.

children.label: startTransition wrapper
children.doc: Schedules the hydration as a transition, allowing the UI to stay responsive during initial work.

children.label: DOM mount: document.getElementById('root')
children.doc: Selects the server-rendered container. Must match server output to avoid hydration mismatch.

children.label: <App initialState={...} />
children.doc: Top-level React component. Receives initial state so client render matches server HTML.

children.label: How nodes relate
children.doc: Globals feed hydration; hydration emits recoverable errors; logging wraps those errors and provides debugging info. Exposing __ROOT__ links runtime state back to tooling.
